Posts.Content: deadra wrote: How can a Radiologist tell on an ultrasound that a cyst is just a cyst?  My cyst is behind the nipple toward the 12:00 area.  It can not be felt.  It is approx 2cm on the compressed mamo and 1.6cm on the ultrasound.  The digital mamography center has an excellect Radiologist and I do trust his opinion.  However, without aspirating the cyst, can I be 100% sure it's just a cyst? What is considered standard protocal? Thank you for your time!! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Cyst Question deadra alligans

Posts.Content: Oct 21, 2010 07:16AM deadra wrote: I have "extremely dense breast".  Have had micro calcifications removed from right breast approx 7 years ago.  I am post menapausal and do not take HRT (but have in the past). Thank you!
